MetaDataType Class Reference

Detailed Description

This class is the base class for objects that are used to create data types.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

void MetaDataType::addAlias ( const std::string &  orig,
const std::string &  alias 
) [static]

This static method adds an alias to a native data type name e.g.

FLOAT to FLOAT32. This is different to alias.xml which aliases a name to a whole data type definition e.g. Gun to FIXED_DICT of 3 properties: STRING name, UINT32 ammo, FLOAT accuracy.

void MetaDataType::addMetaType ( MetaDataType *  pMetaType  )  [static, protected]

This static method registers a meta data type.

This static method deregisters a meta data type.

This static method finds the given meta data type by name.

void MetaDataType::fini (  )  [static]

virtual DataTypePtr MetaDataType::getType ( DataSectionPtr  pSection  )  [pure virtual]

This virtual method is used in the creation of DataTypes.

Once a metatype is found for the current data section, it is asked for the type associated with that data section.

Derived MetaDataTypes should override this method to return their data type.

Implemented in SequenceMetaDataType, ClassMetaDataType, FixedDictMetaDataType, UserMetaDataType, and SimpleMetaDataType< DATATYPE >.

virtual const char* MetaDataType::name (  )  const [pure virtual]

This virtual method should return your basic meta type name.

Implemented in SequenceMetaDataType, ClassMetaDataType, FixedDictMetaDataType, UserMetaDataType, and SimpleMetaDataType< DATATYPE >.
